name: Oh Johnny
tagline: Make use of *duino right in your browser.
body:
### So what is it with this Johnny?
**Oh Johnny** enables you to watch when sensors are being connected to your \*duino board and what kind of signal they produce. **Oh Johnny** makes use of the **johnny-five** library to read sensor data which in turn relies upon a [Firmata prototcol]() implementation for [node.js]().

### How to use it
Since **Oh Johnny** connects the physical world with the digital, a server needs to be started on the machine to which the \*duino is connected, before any browser client may read out and display its signals:

```
$ node install # needed only once
$ node server.js
```

After that, you may point your browser to `http://localhost:3000` and watch your Johnny in action. (This is where the project name starts to sound creepy*â€”Ed.*)

### Current State
Right now, **Oh Johnny** doesn't really read signals from your board, mainly because filtering out analog noises and detecting pin connects seems to be a project in itself. We decided to focus on signal display first, this is why your Johnny seems to be firing events on itself.

### Help welcome!
Anybody with a grasp of knowledge on electronics and/or node programming language is welcome to help with the analog noise/connection detection issues preventing this project from unleashing its full potential.
